qas.question: Where in Tennessee is the headquarters of International Paper?
Where is Nissan Motor Company's headquarters in the United States?
Which company has a $2 billion production plant in Bradley County?
Hemlock Semiconductor produces electronic components in which Tennessee city?
Which major global shipping company is based in Memphis?

context: Major corporations with headquarters in Tennessee include <a4_0>FedEx<a4_0/>, AutoZone and International Paper, all based in <a0_0>Memphis<a0_0/>; Pilot Corporation and Regal Entertainment Group, based in Knoxville; Eastman Chemical Company, based in Kingsport; the North American headquarters of Nissan Motor Company, based in <a1_0>Franklin<a1_0/>; Hospital Corporation of America and Caterpillar Financial, based in Nashville; and Unum, based in Chattanooga. Tennessee is also the location of the Volkswagen factory in Chattanooga, a $2 billion polysilicon production facility by <a2_0>Wacker Chemie<a2_0/> in Bradley County, and a $1.2 billion polysilicon production facility by Hemlock Semiconductor in <a3_0>Clarksville<a3_0/>.
